name: galette
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a thin, flat, round cake made from a mixture of buckwheat flour (= flour made from a small dark grain), milk, and egg, usually eaten with the edges folded inwards and a savoury food inside: Stop in a cafe and try a galette, a buckwheat pancake which is a Breton speciality. Compare
crepe
pancake
a round, flat open pastry cake that has the edges folded roughly inwards and a sweet or savoury food inside: I made a galette with the leftover pastry from yesterday's apple pie. The dish of the day was a pumpkin galette.
More examplesFewer examplesA galette is a special kind of pancake from Brittany.I made an almond galette, and the filling leaked all over the place.Bake for 30 minutes, or until the galette is golden brown.
